channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How Piyush Pandey gave India its most famous political slogan, ‘Ab ki baar, Modi sarkar’
Will Trump’s oil sanctions on Russia hurt Putin and his plans for Ukraine war?
Tomato prices soar 400%: How shutting down of Afghanistan border is hurting Pakistan
Hours after Louvre, another museum robbed in France. What happened?
Mafia, illegal poker games and NBA players: The gambling racket in the US, explained
History Today: When the United Nations was born in the hope for a new beginning
Small state, deft diplomacy: How Qatar has raised its ‘smart power’
item.description: The ability to talk to both sides is Doha’s rarest currency. If any Arab state can help reduce the reflexive hostility between Tehran and the Arab world, it is Qatar

item.title: Bangladesh on the brink: How the Yunus regime’s Islamist purge threatens the military
item.description: Unless Bangladesh’s democratic and security institutions are defended, the world may soon confront a new Islamist axis anchored in Dhaka, destabilising the entire Indo-Pacific theatre.

item.title: China’s influence operations and coercive diplomacy: India’s response offers a blueprint for democracies
item.description: China’s influence operations and coercive diplomacy, as evidenced by actions in the United States, Britain, Canada, Japan, the Philippines and India, represent a systemic challenge to the international order

item.title: How Trump’s sanctions and tariffs have redrawn the world map—and put Eurasia at the centre
item.description: The global oil market is no longer just about barrels and prices; it is about currencies, alliances and power.

item.title: False victories, real losses: How Munir’s delusions risk Pakistan's future
item.description: In these past three and a half decades, Pakistan has suffered terribly economically; its society has become increasingly imbued with extremist Islamic theologies, and its polity has remained unstable. The only institution that has prospered has been the Pakistan Army.

item.title: ‘Rising Dragon’: Chinese art of arrogance and avarice in Tibet
item.description: Cai Guo-Qiang’s Rising Dragon represents the arrogance of a colonial power and the violence it can unleash on a colonised people and their land.
